issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: It might be gagging on the slash. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: security group rules validation is throwing an error on CIDR-formatted IPs that are entered correctly

comments.body: [~kyolee] I think some of your recent changes may have fixed this?

[~jloza] 0.0.0.0 is an invalid form of CIDR, which is X.X.X.X/X

Try 0.0.0.0/0 or 0.0.0.0/32.
The format used in the screenshow was invalid. See the comment above.

[~kyolee] I know that is not a complete CIDR address. I was about to enter the slash when the error was displayed. The point is that the dialog throws the validation error when I am in the middle of typing, before I have input something incorrect or changed focus. It should not throw an error until I have typed something wrong.

[~jloza] The behavior of the Foundation's live validation would attempt to check the correctness of the input once the final "keyup" is detected. So, if user pauses with an incomplete input, it will attempt to validate the current input, and throw an error message.
[~kyolee], I didn't pause, I was happily typing away. [~kgill] thought maybe it was gagging on the slash or something?

[~jloza]: Yeah, looks like a Foundation bug where validation kicks in right away on the slash.  Hoping a more recent version of Foundation has fixed this issue, but there's not much we can do about it on our end for now.
Is there no workaround? This is terrible UX.

[~jloza] [~kgill] No, it's not the "/" issue. It's timing. The live validation kicks in after detecting the first keypress. So, by the time you reach "/", it would kick in. If you type fast enough, you would be able to bypass the first validation attempt.
[~kyolee], [~jloza], [~kgill], could you simply as a workaround in 4.0 not validate this field?  We must be able to turn it off for some fields....

[~kyolee] let's try that...it is terrible UX for a system to tell me I have made an error when I haven't, we really need to figure out something to do here. Let us know how that goes! A person should be able to type int here at a reasonable speed and not get errors. Thanks!
[~kyolee] Ok, let's try the Foundation Abide config option.  Deferring to [~jloza] on what the validation timeout should be.
Just type a little slow, like a normal person, and adjust accordingly, with a little extra leeway.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/321

Extending the timeout from 1 sec to 2 sec for the live validaiton

verified timeout delay is 2 seconds. 

verified on mac osx 10.9.2, chrome Version 33.0.1750.152
